trans-unit.source: Azure Search Service REST API Version 2015-02-28-Preview | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure Search Service REST API Version 2015-02-28-Preview | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Azure Search Service REST API Version 2015-02-28-Preview includes experimental features such as Natural Language Analyzers and moreLikeThis searches.
trans-unit.target: Azure Search Service REST API Version 2015-02-28-Preview includes experimental features such as Natural Language Analyzers and moreLikeThis searches.

trans-unit.source: Azure Search Service REST API: Version 2015-02-28-Preview
trans-unit.target: Azure Search Service REST API: Version 2015-02-28-Preview

trans-unit.source: This article is the reference documentation for `api-version=2015-02-28-Preview`.
trans-unit.target: This article is the reference documentation for `api-version=2015-02-28-Preview`.

trans-unit.source: This preview extends the current generally available version, [api-version=2015-02-28](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn798935.aspx), by providing the following experimental features:
trans-unit.target: This preview extends the current generally available version, [api-version=2015-02-28](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn798935.aspx), by providing the following experimental features:

trans-unit.source: [Natural language processors](#LanguageSupport) from Microsoft (the same ones used by Office and Bing) offer greater precision over query results and more languages.
trans-unit.target: [Natural language processors](#LanguageSupport) from Microsoft (the same ones used by Office and Bing) offer greater precision over query results and more languages.

trans-unit.source: `moreLikeThis` is a a query parameter used in [Search operations](#SearchDocs) that finds other documents that are relevant to another specific document.
trans-unit.target: `moreLikeThis` is a a query parameter used in [Search operations](#SearchDocs) that finds other documents that are relevant to another specific document.

trans-unit.source: A POST alternative to the GET syntax for both the [Search](#SearchDocs) and [Suggestions](#Suggestions) API, useful when the overall URL length would otherwise exceed 8KB.
trans-unit.target: A POST alternative to the GET syntax for both the [Search](#SearchDocs) and [Suggestions](#Suggestions) API, useful when the overall URL length would otherwise exceed 8KB.

trans-unit.source: A few additional features in `2015-02-28-Preview` are documented separately.
trans-unit.target: A few additional features in `2015-02-28-Preview` are documented separately.

trans-unit.source: Index Operations
trans-unit.target: Index Operations

trans-unit.source: You can create and manage indexes in Azure Search service via simple HTTP requests (POST, GET, PUT, DELETE) against a given index resource.
trans-unit.target: You can create and manage indexes in Azure Search service via simple HTTP requests (POST, GET, PUT, DELETE) against a given index resource.

trans-unit.source: To create an index, you first POST a JSON document that describes the index schema.
trans-unit.target: To create an index, you first POST a JSON document that describes the index schema.

trans-unit.source: The schema defines the fields of the index, their data types, and how they can be used (for example, in full-text searches, filters, sorting, or faceting).
trans-unit.target: The schema defines the fields of the index, their data types, and how they can be used (for example, in full-text searches, filters, sorting, or faceting).

trans-unit.source: It also defines scoring profiles, suggesters and other attributes to configure the behavior of the index.
trans-unit.target: It also defines scoring profiles, suggesters and other attributes to configure the behavior of the index.

trans-unit.source: The following example provides an illustration of a schema used for searching on hotel information with the Description field defined in two languages.
trans-unit.target: The following example provides an illustration of a schema used for searching on hotel information with the Description field defined in two languages.

trans-unit.source: Notice how attributes control how the field is used.
trans-unit.target: Notice how attributes control how the field is used.

trans-unit.source: For example the `hotelId` is used as the document key (`"key": true`) and is excluded from full-text searches (`"searchable": false`).
trans-unit.target: For example the `hotelId` is used as the document key (`"key": true`) and is excluded from full-text searches (`"searchable": false`).

trans-unit.source: After the index is created, you'll upload documents that populate the index.
trans-unit.target: After the index is created, you'll upload documents that populate the index.

trans-unit.source: See [Add or Update Documents](#AddOrUpdateDocuments) for this next step.
trans-unit.target: See [Add or Update Documents](#AddOrUpdateDocuments) for this next step.

trans-unit.source: For a video introduction to indexing in Azure Search, see the [Channel 9 Cloud Cover episode on Azure Search](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=511509).
trans-unit.target: For a video introduction to indexing in Azure Search, see the [Channel 9 Cloud Cover episode on Azure Search](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=511509).

trans-unit.source: Create Index
trans-unit.target: Create Index

trans-unit.source: An index is the primary means of organizing and searching documents in Azure Search, similar to how a table organizes records in a database.
trans-unit.target: An index is the primary means of organizing and searching documents in Azure Search, similar to how a table organizes records in a database.

trans-unit.source: Each index has a collection of documents that all conform to the index schema (field names, data types, and properties), but indexes also specify additional constructs (suggesters, scoring profiles, and CORS options) that define other search behaviors.
trans-unit.target: Each index has a collection of documents that all conform to the index schema (field names, data types, and properties), but indexes also specify additional constructs (suggesters, scoring profiles, and CORS options) that define other search behaviors.

trans-unit.source: You can create a new index within an Azure Search service using an HTTP POST or PUT request.
trans-unit.target: You can create a new index within an Azure Search service using an HTTP POST or PUT request.

trans-unit.source: The body of the request is a JSON schema that specifies the index and configuration information.
trans-unit.target: The body of the request is a JSON schema that specifies the index and configuration information.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, you can use PUT and specify the index name on the URI.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, you can use PUT and specify the index name on the URI.

trans-unit.source: If the index does not exist, it will be created.
trans-unit.target: If the index does not exist, it will be created.

trans-unit.source: Creating an index determines the structure of the documents stored and used in search operations.
trans-unit.target: Creating an index determines the structure of the documents stored and used in search operations.

trans-unit.source: Populating the index is a separate operation.
trans-unit.target: Populating the index is a separate operation.

trans-unit.source: For this step, you can use an [indexer](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/mt183328.aspx) (available for supported data sources) or an [Add, Update, or Delete Documents](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn798930.aspx) operation.
trans-unit.target: For this step, you can use an [indexer](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/mt183328.aspx) (available for supported data sources) or an [Add, Update, or Delete Documents](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn798930.aspx) operation.

trans-unit.source: The inverted index is generated when the documents are posted.
trans-unit.target: The inverted index is generated when the documents are posted.

trans-unit.source: **Note**: The maximum number of indexes allowed varies by pricing tier.
trans-unit.target: **Note**: The maximum number of indexes allowed varies by pricing tier.

trans-unit.source: The free service allows up to 3 indexes.
trans-unit.target: The free service allows up to 3 indexes.

trans-unit.source: Standard service allows 50 indexes per Search service.
trans-unit.target: Standard service allows 50 indexes per Search service.

trans-unit.source: See [Limits and constraints](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn798934.aspx) for details.
trans-unit.target: See [Limits and constraints](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn798934.aspx) for details.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: HTTPS is required for all service requests.
trans-unit.target: HTTPS is required for all service requests.

trans-unit.source: The **Create Index** request can be constructed using either a POST or PUT method.
trans-unit.target: The **Create Index** request can be constructed using either a POST or PUT method.

trans-unit.source: When using POST, you must provide an index name in the request body along with the index schema definition.
trans-unit.target: When using POST, you must provide an index name in the request body along with the index schema definition.

trans-unit.source: With PUT, the index name is part of the URL.
trans-unit.target: With PUT, the index name is part of the URL.

trans-unit.source: If the index doesn't exist, it is created.
trans-unit.target: If the index doesn't exist, it is created.

trans-unit.source: If it already exists, it is updated to the new definition.
trans-unit.target: If it already exists, it is updated to the new definition.

trans-unit.source: The index name must be lower case, start with a letter or number, have no slashes or dots, and be less than 128 characters.
trans-unit.target: The index name must be lower case, start with a letter or number, have no slashes or dots, and be less than 128 characters.

trans-unit.source: After starting the index name with a letter or number, the rest of the name can include any letter, number and dashes, as long as the dashes are not consecutive.
trans-unit.target: After starting the index name with a letter or number, the rest of the name can include any letter, number and dashes, as long as the dashes are not consecutive.

trans-unit.source: The `api-version` is required.
trans-unit.target: The `api-version` is required.

trans-unit.source: See [Search Service Versioning](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn864560.aspx) for a list of available versions.
trans-unit.target: See [Search Service Versioning](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn864560.aspx) for a list of available versions.

trans-unit.source: Request Headers
trans-unit.target: Request Headers

trans-unit.source: The following list describes the required and optional request headers.
trans-unit.target: The following list describes the required and optional request headers.

trans-unit.source: `Content-Type`: Required.
trans-unit.target: `Content-Type`: Required.

trans-unit.source: Set this to `application/json`
trans-unit.target: Set this to `application/json`

trans-unit.source: `api-key`: Required.
trans-unit.target: `api-key`: Required.

trans-unit.source: The `api-key` is used to
trans-unit.target: The `api-key` is used to

trans-unit.source: authenticate the request to your Search service.
trans-unit.target: authenticate the request to your Search service.

trans-unit.source: It is a string value, unique to your service.
trans-unit.target: It is a string value, unique to your service.

trans-unit.source: The **Create Index** request must include an `api-key` header set to your admin key (as opposed to a query key).
trans-unit.target: The **Create Index** request must include an `api-key` header set to your admin key (as opposed to a query key).

trans-unit.source: You will also need the service name to construct the request URL.
trans-unit.target: You will also need the service name to construct the request URL.

trans-unit.source: You can get the service name and `api-key` from your service dashboard in the Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: You can get the service name and `api-key` from your service dashboard in the Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: See [Create an Azure Search service in the portal](search-create-service-portal.md) for page navigation help.
trans-unit.target: See [Create an Azure Search service in the portal](search-create-service-portal.md) for page navigation help.

trans-unit.source: **Request Body Syntax**
trans-unit.target: **Request Body Syntax**

trans-unit.source: The body of the request contains a schema definition, which includes the list of data fields within documents that will be fed into this index, data types, attributes, as well as an optional list of scoring profiles that are used to score matching documents at query time.
trans-unit.target: The body of the request contains a schema definition, which includes the list of data fields within documents that will be fed into this index, data types, attributes, as well as an optional list of scoring profiles that are used to score matching documents at query time.

trans-unit.source: Note that for a POST request, you must specify the index name in the request body.
trans-unit.target: Note that for a POST request, you must specify the index name in the request body.

trans-unit.source: There can only be one key field in the index.
trans-unit.target: There can only be one key field in the index.

trans-unit.source: It has to be a string field.
trans-unit.target: It has to be a string field.

trans-unit.source: This field represents the unique identifier for each document stored within the index.
trans-unit.target: This field represents the unique identifier for each document stored within the index.

trans-unit.source: The main parts of an index include the following:
trans-unit.target: The main parts of an index include the following:

trans-unit.source: `fields` that will be fed into this index, including name, data type, and properties that define allowable actions on that field.
trans-unit.target: `fields` that will be fed into this index, including name, data type, and properties that define allowable actions on that field.

trans-unit.source: `suggesters` used for auto-complete or type-ahead queries.
trans-unit.target: `suggesters` used for auto-complete or type-ahead queries.

trans-unit.source: `scoringProfiles` used for custom search score ranking.
trans-unit.target: `scoringProfiles` used for custom search score ranking.

trans-unit.source: See [Add scoring profiles](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn798928.aspx) for details.
trans-unit.target: See [Add scoring profiles](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn798928.aspx) for details.

trans-unit.source: `defaultScoringProfile` used to overwrite the default scoring behaviors.
trans-unit.target: `defaultScoringProfile` used to overwrite the default scoring behaviors.

trans-unit.source: `corsOptions` to allow cross-origin queries against your index.
trans-unit.target: `corsOptions` to allow cross-origin queries against your index.

trans-unit.source: The syntax for structuring the request payload is as follows.
trans-unit.target: The syntax for structuring the request payload is as follows.

trans-unit.source: A sample request is provided further on in this topic.
trans-unit.target: A sample request is provided further on in this topic.

trans-unit.source: Index Attributes
trans-unit.target: Index Attributes

trans-unit.source: The following attributes can be set when creating an index.
trans-unit.target: The following attributes can be set when creating an index.

trans-unit.source: For details about scoring and scoring profiles, see [Add scoring Profiles](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn798928.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For details about scoring and scoring profiles, see [Add scoring Profiles](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn798928.aspx).

trans-unit.source: `name` - Sets the name of the field.
trans-unit.target: `name` - Sets the name of the field.

trans-unit.source: `type` - Sets the data type for the field.
trans-unit.target: `type` - Sets the data type for the field.

trans-unit.source: See [Supported Data Types](#DataTypes) for a list of supported types.
trans-unit.target: See [Supported Data Types](#DataTypes) for a list of supported types.

trans-unit.source: `searchable` - Marks the field as full-text search-able.
trans-unit.target: `searchable` - Marks the field as full-text search-able.

trans-unit.source: This means it will undergo analysis such as word-breaking during indexing.
trans-unit.target: This means it will undergo analysis such as word-breaking during indexing.

trans-unit.source: If you set a `searchable` field to a value like "sunny day", internally it will be split into the individual tokens "sunny" and "day".
trans-unit.target: If you set a `searchable` field to a value like "sunny day", internally it will be split into the individual tokens "sunny" and "day".

trans-unit.source: This enables full-text searches for these terms.
trans-unit.target: This enables full-text searches for these terms.

trans-unit.source: Fields of type `Edm.String` or `Collection(Edm.String)` are `searchable` by default.
trans-unit.target: Fields of type `Edm.String` or `Collection(Edm.String)` are `searchable` by default.

trans-unit.source: Fields of other types cannot be `searchable`.
trans-unit.target: Fields of other types cannot be `searchable`.

trans-unit.source: **Note**: `searchable` fields consume extra space in your index since Azure Search will store an additional tokenized version of the field value for full-text searches.
trans-unit.target: **Note**: `searchable` fields consume extra space in your index since Azure Search will store an additional tokenized version of the field value for full-text searches.

trans-unit.source: If you want to save space in your index and you don't need a field to be included in searches, set `searchable` to `false`.
trans-unit.target: If you want to save space in your index and you don't need a field to be included in searches, set `searchable` to `false`.

trans-unit.source: `filterable` - Allows the field to be referenced in `$filter` queries.
trans-unit.target: `filterable` - Allows the field to be referenced in `$filter` queries.

trans-unit.source: `filterable` differs from `searchable` in how strings are handled.
trans-unit.target: `filterable` differs from `searchable` in how strings are handled.

trans-unit.source: Fields of type `Edm.String` or `Collection(Edm.String)` that are `filterable` do not undergo word-breaking, so comparisons are for exact matches only.
trans-unit.target: Fields of type `Edm.String` or `Collection(Edm.String)` that are `filterable` do not undergo word-breaking, so comparisons are for exact matches only.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you set such a field `f` to "sunny day", `$filter=f eq 'sunny'` will find no matches, but `$filter=f eq 'sunny day'` will.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you set such a field `f` to "sunny day", `$filter=f eq 'sunny'` will find no matches, but `$filter=f eq 'sunny day'` will.

trans-unit.source: All fields are `filterable` by default.
trans-unit.target: All fields are `filterable` by default.

trans-unit.source: `sortable` - By default the system sorts results by score, but in many experiences users will want to sort by fields in the documents.
trans-unit.target: `sortable` - By default the system sorts results by score, but in many experiences users will want to sort by fields in the documents.

trans-unit.source: Fields of type `Collection(Edm.String)` cannot be `sortable`.
trans-unit.target: Fields of type `Collection(Edm.String)` cannot be `sortable`.

trans-unit.source: All other fields are `sortable` by default.
trans-unit.target: All other fields are `sortable` by default.

trans-unit.source: `facetable`- Typically used in a presentation of search results that includes hit count by category (for example, search for digital cameras and see hits by brand, by megapixels, by price, etc.).
trans-unit.target: `facetable`- Typically used in a presentation of search results that includes hit count by category (for example, search for digital cameras and see hits by brand, by megapixels, by price, etc.).

trans-unit.source: This option cannot be used with fields of type `Edm.GeographyPoint`.
trans-unit.target: This option cannot be used with fields of type `Edm.GeographyPoint`.

trans-unit.source: All other fields are `facetable` by default.
trans-unit.target: All other fields are `facetable` by default.

trans-unit.source: **Note**: Fields of type `Edm.String` that are `filterable`, `sortable`, or `facetable` can be at most 32KB in length.
trans-unit.target: **Note**: Fields of type `Edm.String` that are `filterable`, `sortable`, or `facetable` can be at most 32KB in length.

trans-unit.source: This is because such fields are treated as a single search term, and the maximum length of a term in Azure Search is 32KB.
trans-unit.target: This is because such fields are treated as a single search term, and the maximum length of a term in Azure Search is 32KB.

trans-unit.source: If you need to store more text than this in a single string field, you will need to explicitly set `filterable`, `sortable`, and `facetable` to `false` in your index definition.
trans-unit.target: If you need to store more text than this in a single string field, you will need to explicitly set `filterable`, `sortable`, and `facetable` to `false` in your index definition.

trans-unit.source: **Note**: If a field has none of the above attributes set to `true` (`searchable`, `filterable`, `sortable`, or`facetable`) the field is effectively excluded from the inverted index.
trans-unit.target: **Note**: If a field has none of the above attributes set to `true` (`searchable`, `filterable`, `sortable`, or`facetable`) the field is effectively excluded from the inverted index.

trans-unit.source: This option is useful for fields that are not used in queries, but are needed in search results.
trans-unit.target: This option is useful for fields that are not used in queries, but are needed in search results.

trans-unit.source: Excluding such fields from the index improves performance.
trans-unit.target: Excluding such fields from the index improves performance.

trans-unit.source: `suggestions` - Previous versions of the API included a `suggestions` property.
trans-unit.target: `suggestions` - Previous versions of the API included a `suggestions` property.

trans-unit.source: This boolean property is now deprecated and no longer available in either `2015-02-28` or `2015-02-28-Preview`.
trans-unit.target: This boolean property is now deprecated and no longer available in either `2015-02-28` or `2015-02-28-Preview`.

trans-unit.source: Please use the [Suggesters API](#Suggesters) instead.
trans-unit.target: Please use the [Suggesters API](#Suggesters) instead.

trans-unit.source: In the `2014-07-31` version, the `suggestions` property was used to specify whether the field could be used for auto-complete for type ahead, for fields of type `Edm.String` or `Collection(Edm.String)`.
trans-unit.target: In the `2014-07-31` version, the `suggestions` property was used to specify whether the field could be used for auto-complete for type ahead, for fields of type `Edm.String` or `Collection(Edm.String)`.

trans-unit.source: The `suggestions` was `false` by default because it required extra space in your index, but if you enabled it, see [Transition from Preview to General Release in Azure Search](search-transition-from-preview.md) for instructions on how to transition to the new API.
trans-unit.target: The `suggestions` was `false` by default because it required extra space in your index, but if you enabled it, see [Transition from Preview to General Release in Azure Search](search-transition-from-preview.md) for instructions on how to transition to the new API.

trans-unit.source: `key` - Marks the field as containing unique identifiers for documents within the index.
trans-unit.target: `key` - Marks the field as containing unique identifiers for documents within the index.

trans-unit.source: Exactly one field must be chosen as the `key` field and it must be of type `Edm.String`.
trans-unit.target: Exactly one field must be chosen as the `key` field and it must be of type `Edm.String`.

trans-unit.source: Key fields can be used to look up documents directly via the [Lookup API](#LookupAPI).
trans-unit.target: Key fields can be used to look up documents directly via the [Lookup API](#LookupAPI).

trans-unit.source: `retrievable` - Sets whether the field can be returned in a search result.
trans-unit.target: `retrievable` - Sets whether the field can be returned in a search result.

trans-unit.source: This is useful when you want to use a field (for example, margin) as a filter, sorting, or scoring mechanism but do not want the field to be visible to the end user.
trans-unit.target: This is useful when you want to use a field (for example, margin) as a filter, sorting, or scoring mechanism but do not want the field to be visible to the end user.

trans-unit.source: This attribute must be `true` for `key` fields.
trans-unit.target: This attribute must be `true` for `key` fields.

trans-unit.source: `analyzer` - Sets the name of the text analyzer to use for the field.
trans-unit.target: `analyzer` - Sets the name of the text analyzer to use for the field.

trans-unit.source: For the allowed set of values see [Language Support](#LanguageSupport).
trans-unit.target: For the allowed set of values see [Language Support](#LanguageSupport).

trans-unit.source: This option can be used only with `searchable` fields.
trans-unit.target: This option can be used only with `searchable` fields.

trans-unit.source: Once the analyzer is chosen, it cannot be changed for the field.
trans-unit.target: Once the analyzer is chosen, it cannot be changed for the field.

trans-unit.source: `suggesters` - Sets the search mode and fields that are the source of the content for suggestions.
trans-unit.target: `suggesters` - Sets the search mode and fields that are the source of the content for suggestions.

trans-unit.source: See [Suggesters](#Suggesters) for details.
trans-unit.target: See [Suggesters](#Suggesters) for details.

trans-unit.source: `scoringProfiles` - Defines custom scoring behaviors that let you influence which items appear higher in search results.
trans-unit.target: `scoringProfiles` - Defines custom scoring behaviors that let you influence which items appear higher in search results.

trans-unit.source: Scoring profiles are made up of field weights and functions.
trans-unit.target: Scoring profiles are made up of field weights and functions.

trans-unit.source: See [Add scoring Profiles](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn798928.aspx) for more information about the attributes used in a scoring profile.
trans-unit.target: See [Add scoring Profiles](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn798928.aspx) for more information about the attributes used in a scoring profile.

trans-unit.source: **Language support** Searchable fields undergo analysis that most frequently involves word-breaking, text normalization, and filtering out terms.
trans-unit.target: **Language support** Searchable fields undergo analysis that most frequently involves word-breaking, text normalization, and filtering out terms.

trans-unit.source: By default, searchable fields in Azure Search are analyzed with the [Apache Lucene Standard analyzer](http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_9_0/analyzers-common/index.html) which breaks text into elements following the["Unicode Text Segmentation"](http://unicode.org/reports/tr29/) rules.
trans-unit.target: By default, searchable fields in Azure Search are analyzed with the [Apache Lucene Standard analyzer](http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_9_0/analyzers-common/index.html) which breaks text into elements following the["Unicode Text Segmentation"](http://unicode.org/reports/tr29/) rules.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, the standard analyzer converts all characters to their lower case form.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, the standard analyzer converts all characters to their lower case form.

trans-unit.source: Both indexed documents and search terms go through the analysis during indexing and query processing.
trans-unit.target: Both indexed documents and search terms go through the analysis during indexing and query processing.

trans-unit.source: Azure Search supports a variety of languages.
trans-unit.target: Azure Search supports a variety of languages.

trans-unit.source: Each language requires a non-standard text analyzer which accounts for characteristics of a given language.
trans-unit.target: Each language requires a non-standard text analyzer which accounts for characteristics of a given language.

trans-unit.source:
Azure Search offers two types of analyzers:
- 35 analyzers backed by Lucene.
trans-unit.target:
Azure Search offers two types of analyzers:
- 35 analyzers backed by Lucene.

trans-unit.source: - 50 analyzers backed by proprietary Microsoft natural language processing technology used in Office and Bing.
trans-unit.target: - 50 analyzers backed by proprietary Microsoft natural language processing technology used in Office and Bing.

trans-unit.source: Some developers might prefer the more familiar, simple, open-source solution of Lucene.
trans-unit.target: Some developers might prefer the more familiar, simple, open-source solution of Lucene.

trans-unit.source: Lucene analyzers are faster, but the Microsoft analyzers have advanced capabilities, such as lemmatization, word decompounding (in languages like German, Danish, Dutch, Swedish, Norwegian, Estonian, Finish, Hungarian, Slovak) and entity recognition (URLs, emails, dates, numbers).
trans-unit.target: Lucene analyzers are faster, but the Microsoft analyzers have advanced capabilities, such as lemmatization, word decompounding (in languages like German, Danish, Dutch, Swedish, Norwegian, Estonian, Finish, Hungarian, Slovak) and entity recognition (URLs, emails, dates, numbers).

trans-unit.source: If possible, you should run comparisons of both the Microsoft and Lucene analyzers to decide which one is a better fit.
trans-unit.target: If possible, you should run comparisons of both the Microsoft and Lucene analyzers to decide which one is a better fit.

trans-unit.source:
***How they compare***
The Lucene analyzer for English extends the standard analyzer.
trans-unit.target:
***How they compare***
The Lucene analyzer for English extends the standard analyzer.

trans-unit.source: It removes possessives (trailing 's) from words, applies stemming as per [Porter Stemming algorithm](http://tartarus.org/~martin/PorterStemmer/), and removes English [stop words](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stop_words).
trans-unit.target: It removes possessives (trailing 's) from words, applies stemming as per [Porter Stemming algorithm](http://tartarus.org/~martin/PorterStemmer/), and removes English [stop words](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stop_words).

trans-unit.source: In comparison, the Microsoft analyzer performs lemmatization instead of stemming.
trans-unit.target: In comparison, the Microsoft analyzer performs lemmatization instead of stemming.

trans-unit.source: It means it can handle inflected and irregular word forms much better what results in more relevant search results (watch module 7 of [Azure Search MVA presentation](http://www.microsoftvirtualacademy.com/training-courses/adding-microsoft-azure-search-to-your-websites-and-apps) for more details).
trans-unit.target: It means it can handle inflected and irregular word forms much better what results in more relevant search results (watch module 7 of [Azure Search MVA presentation](http://www.microsoftvirtualacademy.com/training-courses/adding-microsoft-azure-search-to-your-websites-and-apps) for more details).

trans-unit.source: Indexing with Microsoft analyzers is on average two to three times slower than their Lucene equivalents, depending on the language.
trans-unit.target: Indexing with Microsoft analyzers is on average two to three times slower than their Lucene equivalents, depending on the language.

trans-unit.source: Search performance should not be significantly affected for average size queries.
trans-unit.target: Search performance should not be significantly affected for average size queries.

trans-unit.source:
***Configuration***
For each field in the index definition, you can set the `analyzer` property to an analyzer name that specifies which language and vendor.
trans-unit.target:
***Configuration***
For each field in the index definition, you can set the `analyzer` property to an analyzer name that specifies which language and vendor.

trans-unit.source: The same analyzer will be applied when indexing and searching for that field.
trans-unit.target: The same analyzer will be applied when indexing and searching for that field.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can have separate fields for English, French, and Spanish hotel descriptions that exist side-by-side in the same index.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can have separate fields for English, French, and Spanish hotel descriptions that exist side-by-side in the same index.

trans-unit.source: Use the ['searchFields' query parameter](#SearchQueryParameters) to specify which language-specific field to search against in your queries.
trans-unit.target: Use the ['searchFields' query parameter](#SearchQueryParameters) to specify which language-specific field to search against in your queries.

trans-unit.source: You can review query examples that include the `analyzer` property in [Search Documents](#SearchDocs).
trans-unit.target: You can review query examples that include the `analyzer` property in [Search Documents](#SearchDocs).

trans-unit.source: Unicode text segmentation (Standard Tokenizer)
trans-unit.target: Unicode text segmentation (Standard Tokenizer)

trans-unit.source: ASCII folding filter - converts Unicode characters that don't belong to the set of first 127 ASCII characters into their ASCII equivalents.
trans-unit.target: ASCII folding filter - converts Unicode characters that don't belong to the set of first 127 ASCII characters into their ASCII equivalents.

trans-unit.source: This is useful for removing diacritics.
trans-unit.target: This is useful for removing diacritics.

trans-unit.target: All analyzers with names annotated with lucene are powered by [Apache Lucene's language analyzers](http://lucene.apache.org/core/4_9_0/analyzers-common/overview-summary.html).

trans-unit.source:
**Suggesters**
A `suggester` defines which fields in an index are used to support auto-complete in searches.
trans-unit.target:
**Suggesters**
A `suggester` defines which fields in an index are used to support auto-complete in searches.

trans-unit.source: Typically partial search strings are sent to the [Suggestions API](#Suggestions) while the user is typing a search query, and the API returns a set of suggested phrases.
trans-unit.target: Typically partial search strings are sent to the [Suggestions API](#Suggestions) while the user is typing a search query, and the API returns a set of suggested phrases.

trans-unit.source: A suggester that you define in the index determines which fields are used to build the type-ahead search terms.
trans-unit.target: A suggester that you define in the index determines which fields are used to build the type-ahead search terms.

trans-unit.source: See [Suggesters](#Suggesters) for configuration details.
trans-unit.target: See [Suggesters](#Suggesters) for configuration details.

trans-unit.source:
**Scoring profiles**
A `scoringProfile` defines custom scoring behaviors that let you influence which items appear higher in the search results.
trans-unit.target:
**Scoring profiles**
A `scoringProfile` defines custom scoring behaviors that let you influence which items appear higher in the search results.

trans-unit.source: Scoring profiles are made up of field weights and functions.
trans-unit.target: Scoring profiles are made up of field weights and functions.

trans-unit.source: To use them, you specify a profile by name on the query string.
trans-unit.target: To use them, you specify a profile by name on the query string.

trans-unit.source: A default scoring profile operates behind the scenes to compute a search score for every item in a result set.
trans-unit.target: A default scoring profile operates behind the scenes to compute a search score for every item in a result set.

trans-unit.source: You can use the internal, unnamed scoring profile.
trans-unit.target: You can use the internal, unnamed scoring profile.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, set `defaultScoringProfile` to use a custom profile as the default, invoked whenever a custom profile is not specified on the query string.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, set `defaultScoringProfile` to use a custom profile as the default, invoked whenever a custom profile is not specified on the query string.

trans-unit.source: See [Add scoring profiles to a search index (Azure Search Service REST API)](search-api-scoring-profiles-2015-02-28.md) for details.
trans-unit.target: See [Add scoring profiles to a search index (Azure Search Service REST API)](search-api-scoring-profiles-2015-02-28.md) for details.

trans-unit.source:
**CORS Options**
Client-side Javascript cannot call any APIs by default since the browser will prevent all cross-origin requests.
trans-unit.target:
**CORS Options**
Client-side Javascript cannot call any APIs by default since the browser will prevent all cross-origin requests.

trans-unit.source: Enable CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) by setting the `corsOptions` attribute to allow cross-origin queries to your index.
trans-unit.target: Enable CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) by setting the `corsOptions` attribute to allow cross-origin queries to your index.

trans-unit.source: Note that only query APIs support CORS for security reasons.
trans-unit.target: Note that only query APIs support CORS for security reasons.

trans-unit.source:
The following options can be set for CORS:
- `allowedOrigins` (required): This is a list of origins that will be granted access to your index.
trans-unit.target:
The following options can be set for CORS:
- `allowedOrigins` (required): This is a list of origins that will be granted access to your index.

trans-unit.source: This means that any Javascript code served from those origins will be allowed to query your index (assuming it provides the correct API key).
trans-unit.target: This means that any Javascript code served from those origins will be allowed to query your index (assuming it provides the correct API key).

trans-unit.source: Each origin is typically of the form `protocol://fully-qualified-domain-name:port` although the port is often omitted.
trans-unit.target: Each origin is typically of the form `protocol://fully-qualified-domain-name:port` although the port is often omitted.

trans-unit.source: See [this article](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=330822) for more details.
trans-unit.target: See [this article](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=330822) for more details.

trans-unit.source: - If you want to allow access to all origins, include `*` as a single item in the `allowedOrigins` array.
trans-unit.target: - If you want to allow access to all origins, include `*` as a single item in the `allowedOrigins` array.

trans-unit.source: Note that **this is not recommended practice for production search services.** However, it may be useful for development or debugging purposes.
trans-unit.target: Note that **this is not recommended practice for production search services.** However, it may be useful for development or debugging purposes.

trans-unit.source: - `maxAgeInSeconds` (optional): Browsers use this value to determine the duration (in seconds) to cache CORS preflight responses.
trans-unit.target: - `maxAgeInSeconds` (optional): Browsers use this value to determine the duration (in seconds) to cache CORS preflight responses.

trans-unit.source: This must be a non-negative integer.
trans-unit.target: This must be a non-negative integer.

trans-unit.source: The larger this value is, the better performance will be, but the longer it will take for CORS policy changes to take effect.
trans-unit.target: The larger this value is, the better performance will be, but the longer it will take for CORS policy changes to take effect.

trans-unit.source: If it is not set, a default duration of 5 minutes will be used.
trans-unit.target: If it is not set, a default duration of 5 minutes will be used.

trans-unit.source: **Request Body Example** { "name": "hotels", "fields": [ {"name": "hotelId", "type": "Edm.String", "key": true, "searchable": false}, {"name": "baseRate", "type": "Edm.Double"}, {"name": "description", "type": "Edm.String", "filterable": false, "sortable": false, "facetable": false}, {"name": "description_fr", "type": "Edm.String", "filterable": false, "sortable": false, "facetable": false, "analyzer"="fr.lucene"}, {"name": "hotelName", "type": "Edm.String"}, {"name": "category", "type": "Edm.String"}, {"name": "tags", "type": "Collection(Edm.String)"}, {"name": "parkingIncluded", "type": "Edm.Boolean"}, {"name": "smokingAllowed", "type": "Edm.Boolean"}, {"name": "lastRenovationDate", "type": "Edm.DateTimeOffset"}, {"name": "rating", "type": "Edm.Int32"}, {"name": "location", "type": "Edm.GeographyPoint"} ], "suggesters": [ { "name": "sg", "searchMode": "analyzingInfixMatching", "sourceFields": ["hotelName"] } ] } **Response** For a successful request: "201 Created".
trans-unit.target: **Request Body Example** { "name": "hotels", "fields": [ {"name": "hotelId", "type": "Edm.String", "key": true, "searchable": false}, {"name": "baseRate", "type": "Edm.Double"}, {"name": "description", "type": "Edm.String", "filterable": false, "sortable": false, "facetable": false}, {"name": "description_fr", "type": "Edm.String", "filterable": false, "sortable": false, "facetable": false, "analyzer"="fr.lucene"}, {"name": "hotelName", "type": "Edm.String"}, {"name": "category", "type": "Edm.String"}, {"name": "tags", "type": "Collection(Edm.String)"}, {"name": "parkingIncluded", "type": "Edm.Boolean"}, {"name": "smokingAllowed", "type": "Edm.Boolean"}, {"name": "lastRenovationDate", "type": "Edm.DateTimeOffset"}, {"name": "rating", "type": "Edm.Int32"}, {"name": "location", "type": "Edm.GeographyPoint"} ], "suggesters": [ { "name": "sg", "searchMode": "analyzingInfixMatching", "sourceFields": ["hotelName"] } ] } **Response** For a successful request: "201 Created".

trans-unit.source: By default the response body will contain the JSON for the index definition that was created.
trans-unit.target: By default the response body will contain the JSON for the index definition that was created.

trans-unit.source: If the `Prefer` request header is set to `return=minimal`, the response body will be empty and the success status code will be "204 No Content" instead of "201 Created".
trans-unit.target: If the `Prefer` request header is set to `return=minimal`, the response body will be empty and the success status code will be "204 No Content" instead of "201 Created".

trans-unit.source: This is true regardless of whether PUT or POST was used to create the index.
trans-unit.target: This is true regardless of whether PUT or POST was used to create the index.

trans-unit.source:
**Remarks**
Currently, there is limited support for index schema updates.
trans-unit.target:
**Remarks**
Currently, there is limited support for index schema updates.

trans-unit.source: Any schema updates that would require re-indexing such as changing field types are not currently supported.
trans-unit.target: Any schema updates that would require re-indexing such as changing field types are not currently supported.

trans-unit.source: Although existing fields cannot be changed or deleted, new fields can be added to an existing index at any time.
trans-unit.target: Although existing fields cannot be changed or deleted, new fields can be added to an existing index at any time.

trans-unit.source: When a new field is added, all existing documents in the index will automatically have a null value for that field.
trans-unit.target: When a new field is added, all existing documents in the index will automatically have a null value for that field.

trans-unit.source: No additional storage space will be consumed until new documents are added to the index.
trans-unit.target: No additional storage space will be consumed until new documents are added to the index.

trans-unit.source: ##Suggesters The suggestions feature in Azure Search is a type-ahead or auto-complete query capability, providing a list of potential search terms in response to partial string inputs entered into a search box.
trans-unit.target: ##Suggesters The suggestions feature in Azure Search is a type-ahead or auto-complete query capability, providing a list of potential search terms in response to partial string inputs entered into a search box.

trans-unit.source: You've probably noticed query suggestions when using commercial web search engines: typing ".NET" in Bing produces a list of terms for ".NET 4.5", ".NET Framework 3.5", and so forth.
trans-unit.target: You've probably noticed query suggestions when using commercial web search engines: typing ".NET" in Bing produces a list of terms for ".NET 4.5", ".NET Framework 3.5", and so forth.

trans-unit.source:
When using the Search service REST API, implementing suggestions in a custom Azure Search application requires the following:
- Enable suggestions by adding a **suggester** construction in your index, giving the name, search mode, and a list of fields for which type-ahead is invoked.
trans-unit.target:
When using the Search service REST API, implementing suggestions in a custom Azure Search application requires the following:
- Enable suggestions by adding a **suggester** construction in your index, giving the name, search mode, and a list of fields for which type-ahead is invoked.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you specify "cityName" as a source field, typing a partial search string of "Sea" will result in "Seattle", "Seaside", and "Seatac" (all three are actual city names) offered up as query suggestions to the user.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you specify "cityName" as a source field, typing a partial search string of "Sea" will result in "Seattle", "Seaside", and "Seatac" (all three are actual city names) offered up as query suggestions to the user.

trans-unit.source: - Invoke suggestions by calling the [Suggestions API](#Suggestions) in your application code.
trans-unit.target: - Invoke suggestions by calling the [Suggestions API](#Suggestions) in your application code.

trans-unit.source: Typically partial search strings are sent to the service while the user is typing a search query, and this API returns a set of suggested phrases.
trans-unit.target: Typically partial search strings are sent to the service while the user is typing a search query, and this API returns a set of suggested phrases.

trans-unit.source: This article explains how to configure a **suggester**.
trans-unit.target: This article explains how to configure a **suggester**.

trans-unit.source: You should also review the [Suggestions API](#Suggestions) for details on how a suggester is used.
trans-unit.target: You should also review the [Suggestions API](#Suggestions) for details on how a suggester is used.

trans-unit.source:
**Usage**
`Suggesters` are created in the index and work best when used to suggest specific documents rather than loose terms or phrases.
trans-unit.target:
**Usage**
`Suggesters` are created in the index and work best when used to suggest specific documents rather than loose terms or phrases.

trans-unit.source: The best candidate fields are titles, names, and other relatively short phrases that can identify an item.
trans-unit.target: The best candidate fields are titles, names, and other relatively short phrases that can identify an item.

trans-unit.source: Less effective are repetitive fields, such as categories and tags, or very long fields such as descriptions or comments fields.
trans-unit.target: Less effective are repetitive fields, such as categories and tags, or very long fields such as descriptions or comments fields.

trans-unit.source: As part of the index definition, you can add a single suggester to the `suggesters` collection.
trans-unit.target: As part of the index definition, you can add a single suggester to the `suggesters` collection.

trans-unit.source:
Properties that define a suggester include the following:
- `name`: The name of the suggester.
trans-unit.target:
Properties that define a suggester include the following:
- `name`: The name of the suggester.

trans-unit.source: You use the name of the suggester when calling the `suggest` API.
trans-unit.target: You use the name of the suggester when calling the `suggest` API.

trans-unit.source: - `searchMode`: The strategy used to search for candidate phrases.
trans-unit.target: - `searchMode`: The strategy used to search for candidate phrases.

trans-unit.source: The only mode currently supported is `analyzingInfixMatching`, which performs flexible matching of phrases at the beginning or in the middle of sentences.
trans-unit.target: The only mode currently supported is `analyzingInfixMatching`, which performs flexible matching of phrases at the beginning or in the middle of sentences.

trans-unit.source: - `sourceFields`: A list of one or more fields that are the source of the content for suggestions.
trans-unit.target: - `sourceFields`: A list of one or more fields that are the source of the content for suggestions.

trans-unit.source: Only fields of type `Edm.String` and `Collection(Edm.String)` may be sources for suggestions.
trans-unit.target: Only fields of type `Edm.String` and `Collection(Edm.String)` may be sources for suggestions.

trans-unit.source: Only fields that don't have a custom language analyzer set can be used.
trans-unit.target: Only fields that don't have a custom language analyzer set can be used.

trans-unit.source:
**Suggester Example**
A suggester is part of the index.
trans-unit.target:
**Suggester Example**
A suggester is part of the index.

trans-unit.source: Only one suggester can exist in the `suggesters` collection in the current version, alongside the fields collection and `scoringProfiles`.
trans-unit.target: Only one suggester can exist in the `suggesters` collection in the current version, alongside the fields collection and `scoringProfiles`.

trans-unit.source: Its replacement, `suggesters`, supports infix matching that finds matching terms at the beginning or in the middle of field content, with better tolerance for mistakes in search strings.
trans-unit.target: Its replacement, `suggesters`, supports infix matching that finds matching terms at the beginning or in the middle of field content, with better tolerance for mistakes in search strings.

trans-unit.source: Starting with the generally available release, this is now the only implementation of the suggestions API.
trans-unit.target: Starting with the generally available release, this is now the only implementation of the suggestions API.

trans-unit.source: The older `suggestions` property that was introduced in `api-version=2014-07-31-Preview` continues to work in that version, but is not operational in the `2015-02-28` or later versions of Azure Search.
trans-unit.target: The older `suggestions` property that was introduced in `api-version=2014-07-31-Preview` continues to work in that version, but is not operational in the `2015-02-28` or later versions of Azure Search.

trans-unit.source: ## Update Index You can update an existing index within Azure Search using an HTTP PUT request.
trans-unit.target: ## Update Index You can update an existing index within Azure Search using an HTTP PUT request.

trans-unit.source: Updates can include adding new fields to the existing schema, modifying CORS options, and modifying scoring profiles.
trans-unit.target: Updates can include adding new fields to the existing schema, modifying CORS options, and modifying scoring profiles.

trans-unit.source: See [Add scoring Profiles](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn798928.aspx) for more information.
trans-unit.target: See [Add scoring Profiles](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn798928.aspx) for more information.

trans-unit.source:
You specify the name of the index to update on the request URI:
PUT https://[search service url]/indexes/[index name]?api-version=[api-version] Content-Type: application/json api-key: [admin key]
**Important:** Support for index schema updates is limited to operations that don't require rebuilding the search index.
trans-unit.target:
You specify the name of the index to update on the request URI:
PUT https://[search service url]/indexes/[index name]?api-version=[api-version] Content-Type: application/json api-key: [admin key]
**Important:** Support for index schema updates is limited to operations that don't require rebuilding the search index.

trans-unit.source: Any schema updates that would require re-indexing, such as changing field types, are not currently supported.
trans-unit.target: Any schema updates that would require re-indexing, such as changing field types, are not currently supported.

trans-unit.source: New fields can be added at any time, although existing fields cannot be changed or deleted.
trans-unit.target: New fields can be added at any time, although existing fields cannot be changed or deleted.

trans-unit.source: The same applies to `suggesters`.
trans-unit.target: The same applies to `suggesters`.

trans-unit.source: New fields may be added to a suggester at the time the fields are added, but fields cannot be removed from `suggesters` and existing fields cannot be added to `suggesters`.
trans-unit.target: New fields may be added to a suggester at the time the fields are added, but fields cannot be removed from `suggesters` and existing fields cannot be added to `suggesters`.

trans-unit.source: When adding a new field to an index, all existing documents in the index will automatically have a null value for that field.
trans-unit.target: When adding a new field to an index, all existing documents in the index will automatically have a null value for that field.

trans-unit.source: No additional storage space will be consumed until new documents are added to the index.
trans-unit.target: No additional storage space will be consumed until new documents are added to the index.

trans-unit.source:
**Request**
HTTPS is required for all service requests.
trans-unit.target:
**Request**
HTTPS is required for all service requests.

trans-unit.source: The **Update Index** request is constructed using HTTP PUT.
trans-unit.target: The **Update Index** request is constructed using HTTP PUT.

trans-unit.source: With PUT, the index name is part of the URL.
trans-unit.target: With PUT, the index name is part of the URL.

trans-unit.source: If the index doesn't exist, it is created.
trans-unit.target: If the index doesn't exist, it is created.

trans-unit.source: If the index already exists, it is updated to the new definition.
trans-unit.target: If the index already exists, it is updated to the new definition.

trans-unit.source: The index name must be lower case, start with a letter or number, have no slashes or dots, and be less than 128 characters.
trans-unit.target: The index name must be lower case, start with a letter or number, have no slashes or dots, and be less than 128 characters.

trans-unit.source: After starting the index name with a letter or number, the rest of the name can include any letter, number and dashes, as long as the dashes are not consecutive.
trans-unit.target: After starting the index name with a letter or number, the rest of the name can include any letter, number and dashes, as long as the dashes are not consecutive.

trans-unit.source: `api-version=[string]` (required).
trans-unit.target: `api-version=[string]` (required).

trans-unit.source: The preview version is `api-version=2015-02-28-Preview`.
trans-unit.target: The preview version is `api-version=2015-02-28-Preview`.

trans-unit.source: See [Search Service Versioning](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn864560.aspx) for details and alternative versions.
trans-unit.target: See [Search Service Versioning](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn864560.aspx) for details and alternative versions.

trans-unit.source:
**Request Headers**
The following list describes the required and optional request headers.
trans-unit.target:
**Request Headers**
The following list describes the required and optional request headers.

trans-unit.source: - `Content-Type`: Required.
trans-unit.target: - `Content-Type`: Required.

trans-unit.source: Set this to `application/json` - `api-key`: Required.
trans-unit.target: Set this to `application/json` - `api-key`: Required.

trans-unit.source: The `api-key` is used to authenticate the request to your Search service.
trans-unit.target: The `api-key` is used to authenticate the request to your Search service.

trans-unit.source: It is a string value, unique to your service.
trans-unit.target: It is a string value, unique to your service.

trans-unit.source: The **Update Index** request must include an `api-key` header set to your admin key (as opposed to a query key).
trans-unit.target: The **Update Index** request must include an `api-key` header set to your admin key (as opposed to a query key).

trans-unit.source: You will also need the service name to construct the request URL.
trans-unit.target: You will also need the service name to construct the request URL.

trans-unit.source: You can get the service name and `api-key` from your service dashboard in the Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: You can get the service name and `api-key` from your service dashboard in the Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: See [Create an Azure Search service in the portal](search-create-service-portal.md) for page navigation help.
trans-unit.target: See [Create an Azure Search service in the portal](search-create-service-portal.md) for page navigation help.

trans-unit.source:
**Request Body Syntax**
When updating an existing index, the body must include the original schema definition, plus the new fields you are adding, as well as the modified scoring profiles, suggesters and CORS options, if any.
trans-unit.target:
**Request Body Syntax**
When updating an existing index, the body must include the original schema definition, plus the new fields you are adding, as well as the modified scoring profiles, suggesters and CORS options, if any.

trans-unit.source: If you are not modifying the scoring profiles and CORS options, you must include the originals from when the index was created.
trans-unit.target: If you are not modifying the scoring profiles and CORS options, you must include the originals from when the index was created.

trans-unit.source: In general the best pattern to use for updates is to retrieve the index definition with a GET, modify it, then update it with PUT.
trans-unit.target: In general the best pattern to use for updates is to retrieve the index definition with a GET, modify it, then update it with PUT.

trans-unit.source: The schema syntax used to create an index is reproduced here for convenience.
trans-unit.target: The schema syntax used to create an index is reproduced here for convenience.

trans-unit.source: See [Create Index](#CreateIndex) for more details.
trans-unit.target: See [Create Index](#CreateIndex) for more details.

trans-unit.source: By default the response body will be empty.
trans-unit.target: By default the response body will be empty.

trans-unit.source: However, if the `Prefer` request header is set to `return=representation`, the response body will contain the JSON for the index definition that was updated.
trans-unit.target: However, if the `Prefer` request header is set to `return=representation`, the response body will contain the JSON for the index definition that was updated.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the success status code will be "200 OK".
trans-unit.target: In this case, the success status code will be "200 OK".
