trans-unit.source: The `/docs` URL segment in the Azure Search API represents the collection of documents in an index.
trans-unit.target: The `/docs` URL segment in the Azure Search API represents the collection of documents in an index.

trans-unit.source: All operations performed on the collection such as uploading, merging, deleting, or querying documents take place in the context of a single index, so the URLs for these operations will always start with `/indexes/[index name]/docs` for a given index name.
trans-unit.target: All operations performed on the collection such as uploading, merging, deleting, or querying documents take place in the context of a single index, so the URLs for these operations will always start with `/indexes/[index name]/docs` for a given index name.

trans-unit.source: Your application code must either generate JSON documents to upload to Azure Search or you can use an [indexer](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn946891.aspx) to load documents if the data source is either Azure SQL Database or DocumentDB.
trans-unit.target: Your application code must either generate JSON documents to upload to Azure Search or you can use an [indexer](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn946891.aspx) to load documents if the data source is either Azure SQL Database or DocumentDB.

trans-unit.source: Typically, indexes are populated from a single dataset that you provide.
trans-unit.target: Typically, indexes are populated from a single dataset that you provide.

trans-unit.source: You should plan on having one document for each item that you want to search.
trans-unit.target: You should plan on having one document for each item that you want to search.

trans-unit.source: A movie rental application might have one document per movie, a storefront application might have one document per SKU, an online courseware application might have one document per course, a research firm might have one document for each academic paper in their repository, and so on.
trans-unit.target: A movie rental application might have one document per movie, a storefront application might have one document per SKU, an online courseware application might have one document per course, a research firm might have one document for each academic paper in their repository, and so on.

trans-unit.source: Documents consist of one or more fields.
trans-unit.target: Documents consist of one or more fields.

trans-unit.source: Fields can contain text that is tokenized by Azure Search into search terms, as well as non-tokenized or non-text values that can be used in filters or scoring profiles.
trans-unit.target: Fields can contain text that is tokenized by Azure Search into search terms, as well as non-tokenized or non-text values that can be used in filters or scoring profiles.

trans-unit.source: The names, data types, and search features supported for each field are determined by the index schema.
trans-unit.target: The names, data types, and search features supported for each field are determined by the index schema.

trans-unit.source: One of the fields in each index schema must be designated as an ID, and each document must have a value for the ID field that uniquely identifies that document in the index.
trans-unit.target: One of the fields in each index schema must be designated as an ID, and each document must have a value for the ID field that uniquely identifies that document in the index.

trans-unit.source: All other document fields are optional and will default to a null value if left unspecified.
trans-unit.target: All other document fields are optional and will default to a null value if left unspecified.

trans-unit.source: Note that null values do not take up space in the search index.
trans-unit.target: Note that null values do not take up space in the search index.

trans-unit.source: Before you can upload documents, you must have already created the index on the service.
trans-unit.target: Before you can upload documents, you must have already created the index on the service.

trans-unit.source: See [Create Index](#CreateIndex) for details about this first step.
trans-unit.target: See [Create Index](#CreateIndex) for details about this first step.

trans-unit.source: ## Add, Update, or Delete Documents You can upload, merge, merge-or-upload or delete documents from a specified index using HTTP POST.
trans-unit.target: ## Add, Update, or Delete Documents You can upload, merge, merge-or-upload or delete documents from a specified index using HTTP POST.

trans-unit.source: For large numbers of updates, batching of documents (up to 1000 documents per batch or about 16 MB per batch) is recommended.
trans-unit.target: For large numbers of updates, batching of documents (up to 1000 documents per batch or about 16 MB per batch) is recommended.

trans-unit.source:
POST https://[service name].search.windows.net/indexes/[index name]/docs/index?api-version=[api-version] Content-Type: application/json api-key: [admin key]
**Request**
HTTPS is required for all service requests.
trans-unit.target:
POST https://[service name].search.windows.net/indexes/[index name]/docs/index?api-version=[api-version] Content-Type: application/json api-key: [admin key]
**Request**
HTTPS is required for all service requests.

trans-unit.source: You can upload, merge, merge-or-upload or delete documents from a specified index using HTTP POST.
trans-unit.target: You can upload, merge, merge-or-upload or delete documents from a specified index using HTTP POST.

trans-unit.source: The request URI includes [index name], specifying which index to post documents.
trans-unit.target: The request URI includes [index name], specifying which index to post documents.

trans-unit.source: You can only post documents to one index at a time.
trans-unit.target: You can only post documents to one index at a time.

trans-unit.source: `api-version=[string]` (required).
trans-unit.target: `api-version=[string]` (required).

trans-unit.source: The preview version is `api-version=2015-02-28-Preview`.
trans-unit.target: The preview version is `api-version=2015-02-28-Preview`.

trans-unit.source: See [Search Service Versioning](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn864560.aspx) for details and alternative versions.
trans-unit.target: See [Search Service Versioning](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn864560.aspx) for details and alternative versions.

trans-unit.source:
**Request Headers**
The following list describes the required and optional request headers.
trans-unit.target:
**Request Headers**
The following list describes the required and optional request headers.

trans-unit.source: - `Content-Type`: Required.
trans-unit.target: - `Content-Type`: Required.

trans-unit.source: Set this to `application/json` - `api-key`: Required.
trans-unit.target: Set this to `application/json` - `api-key`: Required.

trans-unit.source: The `api-key` is used to authenticate the request to your Search service.
trans-unit.target: The `api-key` is used to authenticate the request to your Search service.

trans-unit.source: It is a string value, unique to your service.
trans-unit.target: It is a string value, unique to your service.

trans-unit.source: The **Add Documents** request must include an `api-key` header set to your admin key (as opposed to a query key).
trans-unit.target: The **Add Documents** request must include an `api-key` header set to your admin key (as opposed to a query key).

trans-unit.source: You will also need the service name to construct the request URL.
trans-unit.target: You will also need the service name to construct the request URL.

trans-unit.source: You can get the service name and `api-key` from your service dashboard in the Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: You can get the service name and `api-key` from your service dashboard in the Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: See [Create an Azure Search service in the portal](.search-create-service-portal.md) for page navigation help.
trans-unit.target: See [Create an Azure Search service in the portal](.search-create-service-portal.md) for page navigation help.

trans-unit.source:
**Request Body**
The body of the request contains one or more documents to be indexed.
trans-unit.target:
**Request Body**
The body of the request contains one or more documents to be indexed.

trans-unit.source: Documents are identified by a unique key.
trans-unit.target: Documents are identified by a unique key.

trans-unit.source: Each document is associated with an action: upload, merge, mergeOrUpload or delete.
trans-unit.target: Each document is associated with an action: upload, merge, mergeOrUpload or delete.

trans-unit.source: Upload requests must include the document data as a set of key/value pairs.
trans-unit.target: Upload requests must include the document data as a set of key/value pairs.

trans-unit.source: Note that all fields are replaced in the update case.
trans-unit.target: Note that all fields are replaced in the update case.

trans-unit.source: - `merge`: Merge updates an existing document with the specified fields.
trans-unit.target: - `merge`: Merge updates an existing document with the specified fields.

trans-unit.source: If the document doesn't exist, the merge will fail.
trans-unit.target: If the document doesn't exist, the merge will fail.

trans-unit.source: Any field you specify in a merge will replace the existing field in the document.
trans-unit.target: Any field you specify in a merge will replace the existing field in the document.

trans-unit.source: This includes fields of type `Collection(Edm.String)`.
trans-unit.target: This includes fields of type `Collection(Edm.String)`.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the document contains a field "tags" with value `["budget"]` and you execute a merge with value `["economy", "pool"]` for "tags", the final value of the "tags" field will be `["economy", "pool"]`.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the document contains a field "tags" with value `["budget"]` and you execute a merge with value `["economy", "pool"]` for "tags", the final value of the "tags" field will be `["economy", "pool"]`.

trans-unit.source: It will **not** be `["budget", "economy", "pool"]`.
trans-unit.target: It will **not** be `["budget", "economy", "pool"]`.

trans-unit.source: - `mergeOrUpload`: behaves like `merge` if a document with the given key already exists in the index.
trans-unit.target: - `mergeOrUpload`: behaves like `merge` if a document with the given key already exists in the index.

trans-unit.source: If the document does not exist it behaves like `upload` with a new document.
trans-unit.target: If the document does not exist it behaves like `upload` with a new document.

trans-unit.source: - `delete`: Delete removes the specified document from the index.
trans-unit.target: - `delete`: Delete removes the specified document from the index.

trans-unit.source: Note that you can specify only the key field value in a `delete` operation.
trans-unit.target: Note that you can specify only the key field value in a `delete` operation.

trans-unit.source: Attempting to specify other fields will result in an HTTP 400 error.
trans-unit.target: Attempting to specify other fields will result in an HTTP 400 error.

trans-unit.source: If you want to remove an individual field from a document, use `merge` instead and simply set the field explicitly to `null`.
trans-unit.target: If you want to remove an individual field from a document, use `merge` instead and simply set the field explicitly to `null`.

trans-unit.source: Please try again later."
trans-unit.target: Please try again later."

trans-unit.source: **Note**: If your client code frequently encounters a 207 response, one possible reason is that the system is under load.
trans-unit.target: **Note**: If your client code frequently encounters a 207 response, one possible reason is that the system is under load.

trans-unit.source: You can confirm this by checking the `errorMessage` property.
trans-unit.target: You can confirm this by checking the `errorMessage` property.

trans-unit.source: If this is the case, we recommend ***throttling indexing requests***.
trans-unit.target: If this is the case, we recommend ***throttling indexing requests***.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, if indexing traffic doesn't subside, the system could start rejecting all requests with 503 errors.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, if indexing traffic doesn't subside, the system could start rejecting all requests with 503 errors.

trans-unit.source: Status code: 429 indicates that you have exceeded your quota on the number of documents per index.
trans-unit.target: Status code: 429 indicates that you have exceeded your quota on the number of documents per index.

trans-unit.source: You must either create a new index or upgrade for higher capacity limits.
trans-unit.target: You must either create a new index or upgrade for higher capacity limits.

trans-unit.source: **Example:** { "value": [ { "@search.action": "upload", "hotelId": "1", "baseRate": 199.0, "description": "Best hotel in town", "description_fr": "Meilleur htel en ville", "hotelName": "Fancy Stay", "category": "Luxury", "tags": ["pool", "view", "wifi", "concierge"], "parkingIncluded": false, "smokingAllowed": false, "lastRenovationDate": "2010-06-27T00:00:00Z", "rating": 5, "location": { "type": "Point", "coordinates": [-122.131577, 47.678581] } }, { "@search.action": "upload", "hotelId": "2", "baseRate": 79.99, "description": "Cheapest hotel in town", "description_fr": "Htel le moins cher en ville", "hotelName": "Roach Motel", "category": "Budget", "tags": ["motel", "budget"], "parkingIncluded": true, "smokingAllowed": true, "lastRenovationDate": "1982-04-28T00:00:00Z", "rating": 1, "location": { "type": "Point", "coordinates": [-122.131577, 49.678581] } }, { "@search.action": "merge", "hotelId": "3", "baseRate": 279.99, "description": "Surprisingly expensive", "lastRenovationDate": null }, { "@search.action": "delete", "hotelId": "4" } ] } ________________________________________ ## Search Documents A **Search** operation is issued as a GET or POST request and specifies parameters that give the criteria for selecting matching documents.
trans-unit.target: **Example:** { "value": [ { "@search.action": "upload", "hotelId": "1", "baseRate": 199.0, "description": "Best hotel in town", "description_fr": "Meilleur htel en ville", "hotelName": "Fancy Stay", "category": "Luxury", "tags": ["pool", "view", "wifi", "concierge"], "parkingIncluded": false, "smokingAllowed": false, "lastRenovationDate": "2010-06-27T00:00:00Z", "rating": 5, "location": { "type": "Point", "coordinates": [-122.131577, 47.678581] } }, { "@search.action": "upload", "hotelId": "2", "baseRate": 79.99, "description": "Cheapest hotel in town", "description_fr": "Htel le moins cher en ville", "hotelName": "Roach Motel", "category": "Budget", "tags": ["motel", "budget"], "parkingIncluded": true, "smokingAllowed": true, "lastRenovationDate": "1982-04-28T00:00:00Z", "rating": 1, "location": { "type": "Point", "coordinates": [-122.131577, 49.678581] } }, { "@search.action": "merge", "hotelId": "3", "baseRate": 279.99, "description": "Surprisingly expensive", "lastRenovationDate": null }, { "@search.action": "delete", "hotelId": "4" } ] } ________________________________________ ## Search Documents A **Search** operation is issued as a GET or POST request and specifies parameters that give the criteria for selecting matching documents.

trans-unit.source:
GET https://[service name].search.windows.net/indexes/[index name]/docs?[query parameters] api-key: [admin or query key]
POST https://[service name].search.windows.net/indexes/[index name]/docs/search?api-version=[api-version] Content-Type: application/json api-key: [admin or query key]
**When to use POST instead of GET**
When you use HTTP GET to call the **Search** API, you need to be aware that the length of the request URL cannot exceed 8 KB.
trans-unit.target:
GET https://[service name].search.windows.net/indexes/[index name]/docs?[query parameters] api-key: [admin or query key]
POST https://[service name].search.windows.net/indexes/[index name]/docs/search?api-version=[api-version] Content-Type: application/json api-key: [admin or query key]
**When to use POST instead of GET**
When you use HTTP GET to call the **Search** API, you need to be aware that the length of the request URL cannot exceed 8 KB.

trans-unit.source: This is usually enough for most applications.
trans-unit.target: This is usually enough for most applications.

trans-unit.source: However, some applications produce very large queries, specifically OData filter expressions.
trans-unit.target: However, some applications produce very large queries, specifically OData filter expressions.

trans-unit.source: For these applications, using HTTP POST is a better choice.
trans-unit.target: For these applications, using HTTP POST is a better choice.

trans-unit.source: The request size limit for POST is close to 17 MB, which is plenty of room for even the most complex queries.
trans-unit.target: The request size limit for POST is close to 17 MB, which is plenty of room for even the most complex queries.

trans-unit.source:
**Request**
HTTPS is required for service requests.
trans-unit.target:
**Request**
HTTPS is required for service requests.

trans-unit.source: The **Search** request can be constructed using the GET or POST methods.
trans-unit.target: The **Search** request can be constructed using the GET or POST methods.

trans-unit.source: The request URI specifies which index to query, for all documents that match the parameters.
trans-unit.target: The request URI specifies which index to query, for all documents that match the parameters.

trans-unit.source: Parameters are specified on the query string in the case of GET requests, and in the request body in the case of POST requests.
trans-unit.target: Parameters are specified on the query string in the case of GET requests, and in the request body in the case of POST requests.

trans-unit.source: As a best practice when creating GET requests, remember to [URL-encode](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.uri.escapedatastring.aspx) specific query parameters when calling the REST API directly.
trans-unit.target: As a best practice when creating GET requests, remember to [URL-encode](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.uri.escapedatastring.aspx) specific query parameters when calling the REST API directly.

trans-unit.source:
For **Search** operations, this includes:
- `$filter` - `facet` - `highlightPreTag` - `highlightPostTag` - `search` - `moreLikeThis`
URL encoding is only recommended on the above query parameters.
trans-unit.target:
For **Search** operations, this includes:
- `$filter` - `facet` - `highlightPreTag` - `highlightPostTag` - `search` - `moreLikeThis`
URL encoding is only recommended on the above query parameters.

trans-unit.source: If you inadvertently URL-encode the entire query string (everything after the ?), requests will break.
trans-unit.target: If you inadvertently URL-encode the entire query string (everything after the ?), requests will break.

trans-unit.source: Also, URL encoding is only necessary when calling the REST API directly using GET.
trans-unit.target: Also, URL encoding is only necessary when calling the REST API directly using GET.

trans-unit.source: No URL encoding is necessary when calling **Search** using POST, or when using the [.NET client library](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn951165.aspx), which handles URL encoding for you.
trans-unit.target: No URL encoding is necessary when calling **Search** using POST, or when using the [.NET client library](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn951165.aspx), which handles URL encoding for you.

trans-unit.source: **Query Parameters** **Search** accepts several parameters that provide query criteria and also specify search behavior.
trans-unit.target: **Query Parameters** **Search** accepts several parameters that provide query criteria and also specify search behavior.

trans-unit.source: You provide these parameters in the URL query string when calling **Search** via GET, and as JSON properties in the request body when calling **Search** via POST.
trans-unit.target: You provide these parameters in the URL query string when calling **Search** via GET, and as JSON properties in the request body when calling **Search** via POST.

trans-unit.source: The syntax for some parameters is slightly different between GET and POST.
trans-unit.target: The syntax for some parameters is slightly different between GET and POST.

trans-unit.source:
These differences are noted as applicable below:
`search=[string]` (optional) - The text to search for.
trans-unit.target:
These differences are noted as applicable below:
`search=[string]` (optional) - The text to search for.

trans-unit.source: All `searchable` fields are searched by default unless `searchFields` is specified.
trans-unit.target: All `searchable` fields are searched by default unless `searchFields` is specified.

trans-unit.source: When searching `searchable` fields, the search text itself is tokenized, so multiple terms can be separated by white space (for example: `search=hello world`).
trans-unit.target: When searching `searchable` fields, the search text itself is tokenized, so multiple terms can be separated by white space (for example: `search=hello world`).

trans-unit.source: To match any term, use `*` (this can be useful for boolean filter queries).
trans-unit.target: To match any term, use `*` (this can be useful for boolean filter queries).

trans-unit.source: Omitting this parameter has the same effect as setting it to `*`.
trans-unit.target: Omitting this parameter has the same effect as setting it to `*`.

trans-unit.source: See [Simple Query Syntax](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn798920.aspx) for specifics on the search syntax.
trans-unit.target: See [Simple Query Syntax](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn798920.aspx) for specifics on the search syntax.

trans-unit.source: - **Note**: The results can sometimes be surprising when querying over `searchable` fields.
trans-unit.target: - **Note**: The results can sometimes be surprising when querying over `searchable` fields.

trans-unit.source: The tokenizer includes logic to handle cases common to English text like apostrophes, commas in numbers, etc. For example, `search=123,456` will match a single term 123,456 rather than the individual terms 123 and 456, since commas are used as thousand-separators for large numbers in English.
trans-unit.target: The tokenizer includes logic to handle cases common to English text like apostrophes, commas in numbers, etc. For example, `search=123,456` will match a single term 123,456 rather than the individual terms 123 and 456, since commas are used as thousand-separators for large numbers in English.

trans-unit.source: For this reason, we recommend using white space rather than punctuation to separate terms in the `search` parameter.
trans-unit.target: For this reason, we recommend using white space rather than punctuation to separate terms in the `search` parameter.

trans-unit.source: `searchMode=any|all` (optional, defaults to `any`) - whether any or all of the search terms must be matched in order to count the document as a match.
trans-unit.target: `searchMode=any|all` (optional, defaults to `any`) - whether any or all of the search terms must be matched in order to count the document as a match.

trans-unit.source: `searchFields=[string]` (optional) - The list of comma-separated field names to search for the specified text.
trans-unit.target: `searchFields=[string]` (optional) - The list of comma-separated field names to search for the specified text.

trans-unit.source: Target fields must be marked as `searchable`.
trans-unit.target: Target fields must be marked as `searchable`.

trans-unit.source: `moreLikeThis=[key]` (optional) **Important:** This feature is only available in `2015-02-28-Preview`.
trans-unit.target: `moreLikeThis=[key]` (optional) **Important:** This feature is only available in `2015-02-28-Preview`.

trans-unit.source: This option cannot be used in a query that contains the text search parameter, `search=[string]`.
trans-unit.target: This option cannot be used in a query that contains the text search parameter, `search=[string]`.

trans-unit.source: The `moreLikeThis` parameter finds documents that are similar to the document specified by the document key.
trans-unit.target: The `moreLikeThis` parameter finds documents that are similar to the document specified by the document key.

trans-unit.source: When a search request is made with `moreLikeThis`, a list of search terms is generated based on the frequency and rarity of terms in the source document.
trans-unit.target: When a search request is made with `moreLikeThis`, a list of search terms is generated based on the frequency and rarity of terms in the source document.

trans-unit.source: Those terms are then used to make the request.
trans-unit.target: Those terms are then used to make the request.

trans-unit.source: By default, the contents of all `searchable` fields are considered unless `searchFields` is used to restrict which fields are searched.
trans-unit.target: By default, the contents of all `searchable` fields are considered unless `searchFields` is used to restrict which fields are searched.

trans-unit.source: `$skip=#` (optional) - the number of search results to skip; Cannot be greater than 100,000.
trans-unit.target: `$skip=#` (optional) - the number of search results to skip; Cannot be greater than 100,000.

trans-unit.source: If you need to scan documents in sequence but cannot use `$skip` due to this limitation, consider using `$orderby` on a totally-ordered key and `$filter` with a range query instead.
trans-unit.target: If you need to scan documents in sequence but cannot use `$skip` due to this limitation, consider using `$orderby` on a totally-ordered key and `$filter` with a range query instead.

trans-unit.source: > [AZURE.NOTE] When calling **Search** using POST, this parameter is named `skip` instead of `$skip`.
trans-unit.target: > [AZURE.NOTE] When calling **Search** using POST, this parameter is named `skip` instead of `$skip`.

trans-unit.source: `$top=#` (optional) - the number of search results to retrieve.
trans-unit.target: `$top=#` (optional) - the number of search results to retrieve.

trans-unit.source: This can be used in conjunction with `$skip` to implement client-side paging of search results.
trans-unit.target: This can be used in conjunction with `$skip` to implement client-side paging of search results.

trans-unit.source: > [AZURE.NOTE] Azure Search uses ***server-side paging*** to prevent queries from retrieving too many documents at once.
trans-unit.target: > [AZURE.NOTE] Azure Search uses ***server-side paging*** to prevent queries from retrieving too many documents at once.

trans-unit.source: The default page size is 50, while the maximum page size is 1000.
trans-unit.target: The default page size is 50, while the maximum page size is 1000.

trans-unit.source: This means that by default **Search** returns at most 50 results if you don't specify `$top`.
trans-unit.target: This means that by default **Search** returns at most 50 results if you don't specify `$top`.

trans-unit.source: If there are more than 50 results, the response includes information to retrieve the next page of at most 50 results (see `@odata.nextLink` and `@search.nextPageParameters` in [the example below](#SearchResponse)).
trans-unit.target: If there are more than 50 results, the response includes information to retrieve the next page of at most 50 results (see `@odata.nextLink` and `@search.nextPageParameters` in [the example below](#SearchResponse)).

trans-unit.source: Similarly, if you specify a value greater than 1000 for `$top` and there are more than 1000 results, only the first 1000 results are returned, along with information to retrieve the next page of at most 1000 results.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, if you specify a value greater than 1000 for `$top` and there are more than 1000 results, only the first 1000 results are returned, along with information to retrieve the next page of at most 1000 results.

trans-unit.source: > [AZURE.NOTE] When calling **Search** using POST, this parameter is named `top` instead of `$top`.
trans-unit.target: > [AZURE.NOTE] When calling **Search** using POST, this parameter is named `top` instead of `$top`.

trans-unit.source: `$count=true|false` (optional, defaults to `false`) - Specifies whether to fetch the total count of results.
trans-unit.target: `$count=true|false` (optional, defaults to `false`) - Specifies whether to fetch the total count of results.

trans-unit.source: Setting this value to `true` may have a performance impact.
trans-unit.target: Setting this value to `true` may have a performance impact.

trans-unit.source: Note that the count returned is an approximation.
trans-unit.target: Note that the count returned is an approximation.

trans-unit.source: > [AZURE.NOTE] When calling **Search** using POST, this parameter is named `count` instead of `$count`.
trans-unit.target: > [AZURE.NOTE] When calling **Search** using POST, this parameter is named `count` instead of `$count`.

trans-unit.source: `$orderby=[string]` (optional) - A list of comma-separated expressions to sort the results by.
trans-unit.target: `$orderby=[string]` (optional) - A list of comma-separated expressions to sort the results by.

trans-unit.source: Each expression can be either a field name or a call to the `geo.distance()` function.
trans-unit.target: Each expression can be either a field name or a call to the `geo.distance()` function.

trans-unit.source: Each expression can be followed by `asc` to indicated ascending, and `desc` to indicate descending.
trans-unit.target: Each expression can be followed by `asc` to indicated ascending, and `desc` to indicate descending.

trans-unit.source: The default is ascending order.
trans-unit.target: The default is ascending order.

trans-unit.source: Ties will be broken by the match scores of documents.
trans-unit.target: Ties will be broken by the match scores of documents.

trans-unit.source: If no `$orderby` is specified, the default sort order is descending by document match score.
trans-unit.target: If no `$orderby` is specified, the default sort order is descending by document match score.

trans-unit.source: There is a limit of 32 clauses for `$orderby`.
trans-unit.target: There is a limit of 32 clauses for `$orderby`.

trans-unit.source: > [AZURE.NOTE] When calling **Search** using POST, this parameter is named `orderby` instead of `$orderby`.
trans-unit.target: > [AZURE.NOTE] When calling **Search** using POST, this parameter is named `orderby` instead of `$orderby`.

trans-unit.source: `$select=[string]` (optional) - A list of comma-separated fields to retrieve.
trans-unit.target: `$select=[string]` (optional) - A list of comma-separated fields to retrieve.

trans-unit.source: If unspecified, all fields marked as retrievable in the schema are included.
trans-unit.target: If unspecified, all fields marked as retrievable in the schema are included.

trans-unit.source: You can also explicitly request all fields by setting this parameter to `*`.
trans-unit.target: You can also explicitly request all fields by setting this parameter to `*`.

trans-unit.source: > [AZURE.NOTE] When calling **Search** using POST, this parameter is named `select` instead of `$select`.
trans-unit.target: > [AZURE.NOTE] When calling **Search** using POST, this parameter is named `select` instead of `$select`.

trans-unit.source: `facet=[string]` (zero or more) - A field to facet by.
trans-unit.target: `facet=[string]` (zero or more) - A field to facet by.

trans-unit.source: Optionally the string may contain parameters to customize the faceting expressed as comma-separated `name:value` pairs.
trans-unit.target: Optionally the string may contain parameters to customize the faceting expressed as comma-separated `name:value` pairs.

trans-unit.source:
Valid parameters are:
- `count` (max number of facet terms; default is 10).
trans-unit.target:
Valid parameters are:
- `count` (max number of facet terms; default is 10).

trans-unit.source: There is no maximum, but higher values incur a corresponding performance penalty, especially if the faceted field contains a large number of unique terms.
trans-unit.target: There is no maximum, but higher values incur a corresponding performance penalty, especially if the faceted field contains a large number of unique terms.

trans-unit.source: - For example: `facet=category,count:5` gets the top five categories in facet results.
trans-unit.target: - For example: `facet=category,count:5` gets the top five categories in facet results.

trans-unit.source: - **Note**: If the `count` parameter is less than the number of unique terms, the results may not be accurate.
trans-unit.target: - **Note**: If the `count` parameter is less than the number of unique terms, the results may not be accurate.

trans-unit.source: This is due to the way faceting queries are distributed across shards.
trans-unit.target: This is due to the way faceting queries are distributed across shards.

trans-unit.source: Increasing `count` generally increases the accuracy of the term counts, but at a performance cost.
trans-unit.target: Increasing `count` generally increases the accuracy of the term counts, but at a performance cost.

trans-unit.source: - `sort` (one of `count` to sort *descending* by count, `-count` to sort *ascending* by count, `value` to sort *ascending* by value, or `-value` to sort *descending* by value) - For example: `facet=category,count:3,sort:count` gets the top three categories in facet results in descending order by the number of documents with each city name.
trans-unit.target: - `sort` (one of `count` to sort *descending* by count, `-count` to sort *ascending* by count, `value` to sort *ascending* by value, or `-value` to sort *descending* by value) - For example: `facet=category,count:3,sort:count` gets the top three categories in facet results in descending order by the number of documents with each city name.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the top three categories are Budget, Motel, and Luxury, and Budget has 5 hits, Motel has 6, and Luxury has 4, then the buckets will be in the order Motel, Budget, Luxury.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the top three categories are Budget, Motel, and Luxury, and Budget has 5 hits, Motel has 6, and Luxury has 4, then the buckets will be in the order Motel, Budget, Luxury.

trans-unit.source: - For example: `facet=rating,sort:-value` produces buckets for all possible ratings, in descending order by value.
trans-unit.target: - For example: `facet=rating,sort:-value` produces buckets for all possible ratings, in descending order by value.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the ratings are from 1 to 5, the buckets will be ordered 5, 4, 3, 2, 1, irrespective of how many documents match each rating.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the ratings are from 1 to 5, the buckets will be ordered 5, 4, 3, 2, 1, irrespective of how many documents match each rating.

trans-unit.source: - `values` (pipe-delimited numeric or `Edm.DateTimeOffset` values specifying a dynamic set of facet entry values) - For example: `facet=baseRate,values:10|20` produces three buckets: One for base rate 0 up to but not including 10, one for 10 up to but not including 20, and one for 20 or higher.
trans-unit.target: - `values` (pipe-delimited numeric or `Edm.DateTimeOffset` values specifying a dynamic set of facet entry values) - For example: `facet=baseRate,values:10|20` produces three buckets: One for base rate 0 up to but not including 10, one for 10 up to but not including 20, and one for 20 or higher.

trans-unit.source: - For example: `facet=lastRenovationDate,values:2010-02-01T00:00:00Z` produces two buckets: One for hotels renovated before February 2010, and one for hotels renovated February 1st, 2010 or later.
trans-unit.target: - For example: `facet=lastRenovationDate,values:2010-02-01T00:00:00Z` produces two buckets: One for hotels renovated before February 2010, and one for hotels renovated February 1st, 2010 or later.

trans-unit.source: - `interval` (integer interval greater than 0 for numbers, or `minute`, `hour`, `day`, `week`, `month`, `quarter`, `year` for date time values) - For example: `facet=baseRate,interval:100` produces buckets based on base rate ranges of size 100.
trans-unit.target: - `interval` (integer interval greater than 0 for numbers, or `minute`, `hour`, `day`, `week`, `month`, `quarter`, `year` for date time values) - For example: `facet=baseRate,interval:100` produces buckets based on base rate ranges of size 100.

trans-unit.source: For example, if base rates are all between $60 and $600, there will be buckets for 0-100, 100-200, 200-300, 300-400, 400-500, and 500-600.
trans-unit.target: For example, if base rates are all between $60 and $600, there will be buckets for 0-100, 100-200, 200-300, 300-400, 400-500, and 500-600.

trans-unit.source: - For example: `facet=lastRenovationDate,interval:year` produces one bucket for each year when hotels were renovated.
trans-unit.target: - For example: `facet=lastRenovationDate,interval:year` produces one bucket for each year when hotels were renovated.

trans-unit.source: - **Note**: `count` and `sort` can be combined in the same facet specification, but they cannot be combined with `interval` or `values`, and `interval` and `values` cannot be combined together.
trans-unit.target: - **Note**: `count` and `sort` can be combined in the same facet specification, but they cannot be combined with `interval` or `values`, and `interval` and `values` cannot be combined together.

trans-unit.source: > [AZURE.NOTE] When calling **Search** using POST, this parameter is named `facets` instead of `facet`.
trans-unit.target: > [AZURE.NOTE] When calling **Search** using POST, this parameter is named `facets` instead of `facet`.

trans-unit.source: Also, you specify it as a JSON array of strings where each string is a separate facet expression.
trans-unit.target: Also, you specify it as a JSON array of strings where each string is a separate facet expression.

trans-unit.source: `$filter=[string]` (optional) - A structured search expression in standard OData syntax.
trans-unit.target: `$filter=[string]` (optional) - A structured search expression in standard OData syntax.

trans-unit.source: See [OData Expression Syntax](#ODataExpressionSyntax) for details on the subset of the OData expression grammar that Azure Search supports.
trans-unit.target: See [OData Expression Syntax](#ODataExpressionSyntax) for details on the subset of the OData expression grammar that Azure Search supports.

trans-unit.source: > [AZURE.NOTE] When calling **Search** using POST, this parameter is named `filter` instead of `$filter`.
trans-unit.target: > [AZURE.NOTE] When calling **Search** using POST, this parameter is named `filter` instead of `$filter`.

trans-unit.source: `highlight=[string]` (optional) - A set of comma-separated field names used for hit highlights.
trans-unit.target: `highlight=[string]` (optional) - A set of comma-separated field names used for hit highlights.

trans-unit.source: Only `searchable` fields can be used for hit highlighting.
trans-unit.target: Only `searchable` fields can be used for hit highlighting.

trans-unit.source: `highlightPreTag=[string]` (optional, defaults to `<em>`) - A string tag that prepends to hit highlights. Must be set with `highlightPostTag`.
trans-unit.target: `highlightPreTag=[string]` (optional, defaults to `<em>`) - A string tag that prepends to hit highlights. Must be set with `highlightPostTag`.

trans-unit.source: > [AZURE.NOTE] When calling **Search** using GET, reserved characters in the URL must be percent-encoded (for example, %23 instead of #).
trans-unit.target: > [AZURE.NOTE] When calling **Search** using GET, reserved characters in the URL must be percent-encoded (for example, %23 instead of #).

trans-unit.source: `highlightPostTag=[string]` (optional, defaults to ``) - a string tag that appends to hit highlights. Must be set with `highlightPreTag`.
trans-unit.target: `highlightPostTag=[string]` (optional, defaults to ``) - a string tag that appends to hit highlights. Must be set with `highlightPreTag`.

trans-unit.source: > [AZURE.NOTE] When calling **Search** using GET, reserved characters in the URL must be percent-encoded (for example, %23 instead of #).
trans-unit.target: > [AZURE.NOTE] When calling **Search** using GET, reserved characters in the URL must be percent-encoded (for example, %23 instead of #).

trans-unit.source: `scoringProfile=[string]` (optional) - The name of a scoring profile to evaluate match scores for matching documents in order to sort the results.
trans-unit.target: `scoringProfile=[string]` (optional) - The name of a scoring profile to evaluate match scores for matching documents in order to sort the results.

trans-unit.source: `scoringParameter=[string]` (zero or more) - Indicates the value for each parameter defined in a scoring function (for example, `referencePointParameter`) using the format name:value.
trans-unit.target: `scoringParameter=[string]` (zero or more) - Indicates the value for each parameter defined in a scoring function (for example, `referencePointParameter`) using the format name:value.

trans-unit.source:
For example, if the scoring profile defines a function with a parameter called "mylocation" the query string option would be &scoringParameter=mylocation:-122.2,44.8
> [AZURE.NOTE] When calling **Search** using POST, this parameter is named `scoringParameters` instead of `scoringParameter`.
trans-unit.target:
For example, if the scoring profile defines a function with a parameter called "mylocation" the query string option would be &scoringParameter=mylocation:-122.2,44.8
> [AZURE.NOTE] When calling **Search** using POST, this parameter is named `scoringParameters` instead of `scoringParameter`.

trans-unit.source: Also, you specify it as a JSON array of strings where each string is a separate name:value pair.
trans-unit.target: Also, you specify it as a JSON array of strings where each string is a separate name:value pair.

trans-unit.source: `minimumCoverage` (optional, defaults to 100) - a number between 0 and 100 indicating the percentage of the index that must be covered by a search query in order for the query to be reported as a success.
trans-unit.target: `minimumCoverage` (optional, defaults to 100) - a number between 0 and 100 indicating the percentage of the index that must be covered by a search query in order for the query to be reported as a success.

trans-unit.source: By default, the entire index must be available or `Search` will return HTTP status code 503.
trans-unit.target: By default, the entire index must be available or `Search` will return HTTP status code 503.

trans-unit.source: If you set `minimumCoverage` and `Search` succeeds, it will return HTTP 200 and include a `@search.coverage` value in the response indicating the percentage of the index that was included in the query.
trans-unit.target: If you set `minimumCoverage` and `Search` succeeds, it will return HTTP 200 and include a `@search.coverage` value in the response indicating the percentage of the index that was included in the query.

trans-unit.source: > [AZURE.NOTE] Setting this parameter to a value lower than 100 can be useful for ensuring search availability even for services with only one replica.
trans-unit.target: > [AZURE.NOTE] Setting this parameter to a value lower than 100 can be useful for ensuring search availability even for services with only one replica.

trans-unit.source: However, not all matching documents are guaranteed to be present in the search results.
trans-unit.target: However, not all matching documents are guaranteed to be present in the search results.

trans-unit.source: If search recall is more important to your application than availability, then it's best to leave `minimumCoverage` at its default value of 100.
trans-unit.target: If search recall is more important to your application than availability, then it's best to leave `minimumCoverage` at its default value of 100.

**Request Headers**
The following list describes the required and optional request headers.
trans-unit.target:
**Request Headers**

trans-unit.source: - `api-key`: The `api-key` is used to authenticate the request to your Search service.
trans-unit.target: - `api-key`: The `api-key` is used to authenticate the request to your Search service.

trans-unit.source: It is a string value, unique to your service URL.
trans-unit.target: It is a string value, unique to your service URL.

trans-unit.source: The **Search** request can specify either an admin key or query key for `api-key`.
trans-unit.target: The **Search** request can specify either an admin key or query key for `api-key`.

trans-unit.source: You will also need the service name to construct the request URL.
trans-unit.target: You will also need the service name to construct the request URL.

trans-unit.source: You can get the service name and `api-key` from your service dashboard in the Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: You can get the service name and `api-key` from your service dashboard in the Azure Portal.

trans-unit.target: See [Create an Azure Search service in the portal](search-create-service-portal.md) for page navigation help.

trans-unit.source: ##Lookup Document The **Lookup Document** operation retrieves a document from Azure Search.
trans-unit.target: ##Lookup Document The **Lookup Document** operation retrieves a document from Azure Search.

trans-unit.source: This is useful when a user clicks on a specific search result, and you want to look up specific details about that document.
trans-unit.target: This is useful when a user clicks on a specific search result, and you want to look up specific details about that document.

trans-unit.source:
GET https://[service name].search.windows.net/indexes/[index name]/docs/[key]?[query parameters] api-key: [admin or query key]
**Request**
HTTPS is required for service requests.
trans-unit.target:
GET https://[service name].search.windows.net/indexes/[index name]/docs/[key]?[query parameters] api-key: [admin or query key]
**Request**
HTTPS is required for service requests.

trans-unit.source: The **Lookup Document** request can be constructed as follows.
trans-unit.target: The **Lookup Document** request can be constructed as follows.

trans-unit.source:
GET /indexes/[index name]/docs/key?[query parameters]
Alternatively, you can use the traditional OData syntax for key lookup:
GET /indexes('[index name]')/docs('[key]')?[query parameters]
The request URI includes an [index name] and [key], specifying which document to retrieve from which index.
trans-unit.target:
GET /indexes/[index name]/docs/key?[query parameters]
Alternatively, you can use the traditional OData syntax for key lookup:
GET /indexes('[index name]')/docs('[key]')?[query parameters]
The request URI includes an [index name] and [key], specifying which document to retrieve from which index.

trans-unit.source: You can only get one document at a time.
trans-unit.target: You can only get one document at a time.

trans-unit.source: Use **Search** to get multiple documents in a single request.
trans-unit.target: Use **Search** to get multiple documents in a single request.

trans-unit.target: `api-version=[string]` (required).

trans-unit.target: The preview version is `api-version=2015-02-28-Preview`.

trans-unit.source: ##Suggestions The **Suggestions** operation retrieves suggestions based on partial search input.
trans-unit.target: ##Suggestions The **Suggestions** operation retrieves suggestions based on partial search input.

trans-unit.source: It's typically used in search boxes to provide type-ahead suggestions as users are entering search terms.
trans-unit.target: It's typically used in search boxes to provide type-ahead suggestions as users are entering search terms.

trans-unit.source: Suggestion requests aim at suggesting target documents, so the suggested text may be repeated if multiple candidate documents match the same search input.
trans-unit.target: Suggestion requests aim at suggesting target documents, so the suggested text may be repeated if multiple candidate documents match the same search input.

trans-unit.source: You can use `$select` to retrieve other document fields (including the document key) so that you can tell which document is the source for each suggestion.
trans-unit.target: You can use `$select` to retrieve other document fields (including the document key) so that you can tell which document is the source for each suggestion.

trans-unit.source: A **Suggestions** operation is issued as a GET or POST request.
trans-unit.target: A **Suggestions** operation is issued as a GET or POST request.

trans-unit.source:
GET https://[service name].search.windows.net/indexes/[index name]/docs/suggest?[query parameters] api-key: [admin or query key]
POST https://[service name].search.windows.net/indexes/[index name]/docs/suggest?api-version=[api-version] Content-Type: application/json api-key: [admin or query key]
**When to use POST instead of GET**
When you use HTTP GET to call the **Suggestions** API, you need to be aware that the length of the request URL cannot exceed 8 KB.
trans-unit.target:
GET https://[service name].search.windows.net/indexes/[index name]/docs/suggest?[query parameters] api-key: [admin or query key]
POST https://[service name].search.windows.net/indexes/[index name]/docs/suggest?api-version=[api-version] Content-Type: application/json api-key: [admin or query key]
**When to use POST instead of GET**
When you use HTTP GET to call the **Suggestions** API, you need to be aware that the length of the request URL cannot exceed 8 KB.

trans-unit.source: This is usually enough for most applications.
trans-unit.target: This is usually enough for most applications.

trans-unit.source: However, some applications produce very large queries, specifically OData filter expressions.
trans-unit.target: However, some applications produce very large queries, specifically OData filter expressions.

trans-unit.source: For these applications, using HTTP POST is a better choice.
trans-unit.target: For these applications, using HTTP POST is a better choice.

trans-unit.source: The request size limit for POST is close to 17 MB, which is plenty of room for even the most complex queries.
trans-unit.target: The request size limit for POST is close to 17 MB, which is plenty of room for even the most complex queries.

trans-unit.source:
**Request**
HTTPS is required for service requests.
trans-unit.target:
**Request**
HTTPS is required for service requests.

trans-unit.source: The **Suggestions** request can be constructed using the GET or POST methods.
trans-unit.target: The **Suggestions** request can be constructed using the GET or POST methods.

trans-unit.source: The request URI specifies the name of the index to query.
trans-unit.target: The request URI specifies the name of the index to query.

trans-unit.source: Parameters, such as the partially input search term, are specified on the query string in the case of GET requests, and in the request body in the case of POST requests.
trans-unit.target: Parameters, such as the partially input search term, are specified on the query string in the case of GET requests, and in the request body in the case of POST requests.

trans-unit.source: As a best practice when creating GET requests, remember to [URL-encode](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.uri.escapedatastring.aspx) specific query parameters when calling the REST API directly.
trans-unit.target: As a best practice when creating GET requests, remember to [URL-encode](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.uri.escapedatastring.aspx) specific query parameters when calling the REST API directly.

trans-unit.source:
For **Suggestions** operations, this includes:
- `$filter` - `highlightPreTag` - `highlightPostTag` - `search`
URL encoding is only recommended on the above query parameters.
trans-unit.target:
For **Suggestions** operations, this includes:
- `$filter` - `highlightPreTag` - `highlightPostTag` - `search`
URL encoding is only recommended on the above query parameters.

trans-unit.source: If you inadvertently URL-encode the entire query string (everything after the ?), requests will break.
trans-unit.target: If you inadvertently URL-encode the entire query string (everything after the ?), requests will break.

trans-unit.source: Also, URL encoding is only necessary when calling the REST API directly using GET.
trans-unit.target: Also, URL encoding is only necessary when calling the REST API directly using GET.

trans-unit.source: No URL encoding is necessary when calling **Suggestions** using POST, or when using the [.NET client library](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn951165.aspx), which handles URL encoding for you.
trans-unit.target: No URL encoding is necessary when calling **Suggestions** using POST, or when using the [.NET client library](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn951165.aspx), which handles URL encoding for you.

trans-unit.source:
**Query Parameters**
**Suggestions** accepts several parameters that provide query criteria and also specify search behavior.
trans-unit.target:
**Query Parameters**
**Suggestions** accepts several parameters that provide query criteria and also specify search behavior.

trans-unit.source: You provide these parameters in the URL query string when calling **Suggestions** via GET, and as JSON properties in the request body when calling **Suggestions** via POST.
trans-unit.target: You provide these parameters in the URL query string when calling **Suggestions** via GET, and as JSON properties in the request body when calling **Suggestions** via POST.

trans-unit.source: The syntax for some parameters is slightly different between GET and POST.
trans-unit.target: The syntax for some parameters is slightly different between GET and POST.

trans-unit.source:
These differences are noted as applicable below:
`search=[string]` - the search text to use to suggest queries.
trans-unit.target:
These differences are noted as applicable below:
`search=[string]` - the search text to use to suggest queries.

trans-unit.source: Must be at least 1 character, and no more than 100 characters.
trans-unit.target: Must be at least 1 character, and no more than 100 characters.

trans-unit.source: `highlightPreTag=[string]` (optional) - a string tag that prepends to search hits.
trans-unit.target: `highlightPreTag=[string]` (optional) - a string tag that prepends to search hits.

trans-unit.source: Must be set with `highlightPostTag`.
trans-unit.target: Must be set with `highlightPostTag`.

trans-unit.source: > [AZURE.NOTE] When calling **Suggestions** using GET, reserved characters in the URL must be percent-encoded (for example, %23 instead of #).
trans-unit.target: > [AZURE.NOTE] When calling **Suggestions** using GET, reserved characters in the URL must be percent-encoded (for example, %23 instead of #).

trans-unit.source: `highlightPostTag=[string]` (optional) - a string tag that appends to search hits.
trans-unit.target: `highlightPostTag=[string]` (optional) - a string tag that appends to search hits.

trans-unit.source: Must be set with `highlightPreTag`.
trans-unit.target: Must be set with `highlightPreTag`.

trans-unit.source: > [AZURE.NOTE] When calling **Suggestions** using GET, reserved characters in the URL must be percent-encoded (for example, %23 instead of #).
trans-unit.target: > [AZURE.NOTE] When calling **Suggestions** using GET, reserved characters in the URL must be percent-encoded (for example, %23 instead of #).

trans-unit.source: `suggesterName=[string]` - the name of the suggester as specified in the `suggesters` collection that's part of the index definition.
trans-unit.target: `suggesterName=[string]` - the name of the suggester as specified in the `suggesters` collection that's part of the index definition.

trans-unit.source: A `suggester` determines which fields are scanned for suggested query terms.
trans-unit.target: A `suggester` determines which fields are scanned for suggested query terms.

trans-unit.source: See [Suggesters](#Suggesters) for details.
trans-unit.target: See [Suggesters](#Suggesters) for details.

trans-unit.source: `fuzzy=[boolean]` (optional, default = false) - when set to true this API will find suggestions even if there's a substituted or missing character in the search text.
trans-unit.target: `fuzzy=[boolean]` (optional, default = false) - when set to true this API will find suggestions even if there's a substituted or missing character in the search text.

trans-unit.source: While this provides a better experience in some scenarios it comes at a performance cost as fuzzy suggestion searches are slower and consume more resources.
trans-unit.target: While this provides a better experience in some scenarios it comes at a performance cost as fuzzy suggestion searches are slower and consume more resources.

trans-unit.source: `searchFields=[string]` (optional) - the list of comma-separated field names to search for the specified search text.
trans-unit.target: `searchFields=[string]` (optional) - the list of comma-separated field names to search for the specified search text.

trans-unit.source: Target fields must be enabled for suggestions.
trans-unit.target: Target fields must be enabled for suggestions.

trans-unit.source: `$top=#` (optional, default = 5) - the number of suggestions to retrieve.
trans-unit.target: `$top=#` (optional, default = 5) - the number of suggestions to retrieve.

trans-unit.source: Must be a number between 1 and 100.
trans-unit.target: Must be a number between 1 and 100.

trans-unit.source: > [AZURE.NOTE] When calling **Suggestions** using POST, this parameter is named `top` instead of `$top`.
trans-unit.target: > [AZURE.NOTE] When calling **Suggestions** using POST, this parameter is named `top` instead of `$top`.

trans-unit.source: `$filter=[string]` (optional) - an expression that filters the documents considered for suggestions.
trans-unit.target: `$filter=[string]` (optional) - an expression that filters the documents considered for suggestions.

trans-unit.source: > [AZURE.NOTE] When calling **Suggestions** using POST, this parameter is named `filter` instead of `$filter`.
trans-unit.target: > [AZURE.NOTE] When calling **Suggestions** using POST, this parameter is named `filter` instead of `$filter`.

trans-unit.source: `$orderby=[string]` (optional) - a list of comma-separated expressions to sort the results by.
trans-unit.target: `$orderby=[string]` (optional) - a list of comma-separated expressions to sort the results by.

trans-unit.source: Each expression can be either a field name or a call to the `geo.distance()` function.
trans-unit.target: Each expression can be either a field name or a call to the `geo.distance()` function.

trans-unit.source: Each expression can be followed by `asc` to indicated ascending, and `desc` to indicate descending.
trans-unit.target: Each expression can be followed by `asc` to indicated ascending, and `desc` to indicate descending.

trans-unit.source: The default is ascending order.
trans-unit.target: The default is ascending order.

trans-unit.source: There is a limit of 32 clauses for `$orderby`.
trans-unit.target: There is a limit of 32 clauses for `$orderby`.

trans-unit.source: > [AZURE.NOTE] When calling **Suggestions** using POST, this parameter is named `orderby` instead of `$orderby`.
trans-unit.target: > [AZURE.NOTE] When calling **Suggestions** using POST, this parameter is named `orderby` instead of `$orderby`.

trans-unit.source: `$select=[string]` (optional) - a list of comma-separated fields to retrieve.
trans-unit.target: `$select=[string]` (optional) - a list of comma-separated fields to retrieve.

trans-unit.source: If unspecified, only the document key and suggestion text is returned.
trans-unit.target: If unspecified, only the document key and suggestion text is returned.

trans-unit.source: > [AZURE.NOTE] When calling **Suggestions** using POST, this parameter is named `select` instead of `$select`.
trans-unit.target: > [AZURE.NOTE] When calling **Suggestions** using POST, this parameter is named `select` instead of `$select`.

trans-unit.source: `minimumCoverage` (optional, defaults to 80) - a number between 0 and 100 indicating the percentage of the index that must be covered by a suggestions query in order for the query to be reported as a success.
trans-unit.target: `minimumCoverage` (optional, defaults to 80) - a number between 0 and 100 indicating the percentage of the index that must be covered by a suggestions query in order for the query to be reported as a success.

trans-unit.source: By default, at least 80% of the index must be available or `Suggest` will return HTTP status code 503.
trans-unit.target: By default, at least 80% of the index must be available or `Suggest` will return HTTP status code 503.

trans-unit.source: If you set `minimumCoverage` and `Suggest` succeeds, it will return HTTP 200 and include a `@search.coverage` value in the response indicating the percentage of the index that was included in the query.
trans-unit.target: If you set `minimumCoverage` and `Suggest` succeeds, it will return HTTP 200 and include a `@search.coverage` value in the response indicating the percentage of the index that was included in the query.

trans-unit.source: > [AZURE.NOTE] Setting this parameter to a value lower than 100 can be useful for ensuring search availability even for services with only one replica.
trans-unit.target: > [AZURE.NOTE] Setting this parameter to a value lower than 100 can be useful for ensuring search availability even for services with only one replica.

trans-unit.source: However, not all matching suggestions are guaranteed to be present in the results.
trans-unit.target: However, not all matching suggestions are guaranteed to be present in the results.

trans-unit.source: If recall is more important to your application than availability, then it's best not to lower `minimumCoverage` below its default value of 80.
trans-unit.target: If recall is more important to your application than availability, then it's best not to lower `minimumCoverage` below its default value of 80.
